commit.message:
maint: Fix duplicate symbols when compiling with luajit

Signed-off-by: Tianjia Zhang <tianjia.zhang@linux.alibaba.com>

sys.socket: also use ssize_t in recvfrom for consistency with recv.

* ext/posix/sys/socket.c (Precvfrom): Use a full width ssize_t to
match the return type of recvfrom.
* NEWS.md: Fix a typo.
(Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: bump released version in NEWS.md.

* NEWS.md: Bump release version.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: release administrivia

* NEWS.md: Record release date.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

unistd, sys.socket: fix unsigned ret type when ssize_t required.

Fixes #354, Fixes #361
* ext/posix/sys/socket.c (Precv): Don't try to put a negative result
into an unsigned variable.
* ext/posix/unistd.c (Pread): Likewise.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fized): Updated.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

posix.termio: add missing termios.IUTF8

IUTF8 was documented as a constant, but the corresponding `#ifdef` was
missing.

Because `IUTF8` is not a part of POSIX, and so not always supported,
removed it from the documentation while adding the flag as an XSI
extension.

posix: make sure to preload sys.* submodules.

Fix #355
* lib/posix/init.lua: Add an empty `sys` subtable to the top-level
module return table.  For submodules with names that start with
"sys.", add them into this subtable instead of the top-level table.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: update NEWS.

* NEWS.md (Incompatible Changes, Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>
fix termio.lflag wrong name

maint: output stable ordered argument error types

* ext/include/_helpers.c (optstring): Write argument error types
in asciibetical order.
* ext/posix/signal.c (Psignal): Likewise.
* ext/posix/sys/socket.c (Pgetaddrinfo): Likewise.
* ext/posix/unistd.c (mygetuid, mygetgid): Likewise.
* lib/posix/compat.lua (umask): Specify allowed missing argument,
as well as nil valued argument with richer typecheck 3.0 syntax.
* lib/posix/deprecated.lua (optstring, checkselection)
(Pclock_getres, Pclock_gettime, Pexec, Pexecp, getgroup)
(getpasswd, gmtime, localtime, mktime, openlog, setrlimit)
(strftime, uname): Likewise.
* lib/posix/init.lua (execx, glob, popen, popen_pipeline, spawn):
Likewise.
* spec/posix_deprecated_spec.yaml (getgroup, openlog): Likewise.
* spec/posix_spec.yaml (glob): Likewise.
(chown, ttyname): Move from here...
* spec/posix_unistd_spec.yaml (chown, ttyname): ...to here.
* ext/include/_helpers.c (checkinteger, checkint, checklong)
(optinteger, optint, optlong): Write "integer" in full in type
errors.
* spec/lposix_spec.yaml (fcntl): Expect "integer" in full in
type errors.
* spec/posix_deprecated_spec.yaml (getpasswd, getgroup): Likewise.
* spec/posix_sys_socket_spec.yaml (getaddrinfo): Likewise.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: release administrivia

* NEWS.md: Record release date.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

time: gmtime and localtime set tm_gmtoff and tm_zone on Linux.

Fixes #353
* lukefile (defines): Define _BSD_SOURCE on Linux to ensure the
compiler can see tm_gmtoff and tm_zone fields of struct tm.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Reported-by: Robert Shaw <robert914@me.com>
Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: sync luke with upstream.

* build-aux/luke: Sync with upstream.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: release administrivia

* NEWS.md: Record release date.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

posix: propagate numbers through bindings more carefully.

Fixes #334
* ext/include/_helpers.c (expectinteger, expectoptinteger)
(optintegerfield): New core integer argument checking
functions.
(checkinteger, optinteger): Use them for a new macros that
return a full width lua_Integer.
(checkint, checklong): Refactored to use expectinteger.
(optint, optlong): Refactored to use expectoptinteger.
(checkintfield): Refactored to use checkintegerfield.
(optintfield): Refactored to use optintegerfield.
(checklongfield, optlongfield): New macros for consistency.
(pushintresult): Rename from this...
(pushintegerresult): ...to this, for consistency with other
uncasted lua_Integer functions.  Adjust all callers
accordingly.
* ext/posix/fcntl.c (Pposix_fadvise): Cast wider lua_Integer
value to off_t type argument.
* ext/posix/unistd.c (Pftruncate, Plseek, Ptruncate, Pwrite):
Likewise.
* ext/posix/fcntl.c (Popen): Likewise for mode_t type arguments.
* ext/posix/sys/stat.c (PS_ISBLK, PS_ISCHR, PS_ISDIR, PS_ISFIFO)
(PS_ISLNK, PS_ISREG, PS_ISSOCK, Pchmod, Pmkdir, Pmkfifo, Pumask):
Likewise.
* ext/posix/grp.c (Pgetgrgid): Likewise for gid_t type
argument.
* ext/posix/wait.c (Pwait): Likewise.
* ext/posix/pwd.c (Pgetpwuid): Likewise for pid_t type
argument.
* ext/posix/sched.c (Psched_getscheduler, Psched_setscheduler):
Likewise.
* ext/posix/signal.c (Pkill, Pkillpg): Likewise.
* ext/posix/unistd.c (P_exit, Psetpid, Ptcsetpgrp): Likewise.
* ext/posix/sys/msg.c (tomsqid): Likewise for uid_t and gid_t
type fields.
(Pmsgget): Likewise for key_t type argument.
(Pmsgrcv): Likewise for size_t and long type arguments.
* ext/posix/sys/socket.c (sockaddr_from_lua): Likewise for
uint32_t type fields.
(Precv, Precvfrom): Likewise for size_t type arguments.
(Psetsockopt): Likewise for various wider than int type
arguments.
* ext/posix/time.c (totimespec): Likewise for time_t and long
type fields.
* ext/posix/utime.c (Putime): Likewise.
* ext/posix/fnmatch.c (Pfnmatch): Return lua_Integer type
result.
* ext/posix/signal.c (Praise): Likewise.
* ext/posix/syslog.c (PLOG_MASK): Likewise.
* ext/posix/time.c (Pmktime): Likewise.
* ext/posix/unistd.c (Palarm, Pgetegit, Pgeteuid, Pgetgid)
(Pgetpgrp, Pgetpid, Pgetppid, Pgetuid, Pgethostid, Ppathconf)
(Psleep, Psysconf): Likewise.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

unistd: undefined is not the same as unspecified.

* ext/posix/unistd.c (Pwrite): Use precise language in the
comment describing why we detect a zero nbytes argument and
return 0 early, rather than let the C library handle it.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

resource: propagate more bits for internal rlim_t values.

Fixes #338
* ext/include/_helpers.c (checkintegerfield): Generalize previous
implementation of `checkintfield` to use a lua_Integer, which
normally holds more bits that a C `int`.
(checkintfield): Rewrite as a call to `checkintegerfield` with
result downcast to a C `int` for backwards compatibility.
* ext/posix/sys/resource.c (setrlimit): Use `checkintegerfield`
to extract `rlim_t` values from argument table to preserve more
bits.
(pushrlimit): Use `setintegerfield` instead of `setnumberfield`
to preserve more bits of `rlim_t` values stored in PosixRLimit
tables.
* spec/posix_sys_resource_spec.yaml (getrlimit): Uncomment
RLIMIT_FSIZE example.
* ext/include/_helpers.c (checkintegerfield): Report type errors
with the full word "integer".
* spec/posix_deprecated_spec.yaml, spec/posix_sys_msg_spec.yaml,
spec/posix_sys_resource_spec.yaml, spec/posix_sys_socket_spec.yaml,
spec/posix_time_spec.yaml: Update error string checks to match
"integer" in type errors.
* NEWS.md (Incompatible Changes, Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

time: gmtime and localtime work with more than 2^31 secs.

Fixes #325
* ext/posix/time.c (Pgmtime, Plocaltime): Assign all 64 bits
of argument 1 value to time_t type.
* spec/posix_time_spec.yaml (gmtime, localtime): New examples
with 2^31 second arguments.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

unistd: simplify write, use EINVAL for out of bounds.

* ext/include/_helpers.c (PEOOB): Delete.
* ext/posix/errno.c (Perrno, lua_open_posix_errno):
Adjust accordingly.
* ext/posix/unistd.c (Pwrite): Simplify implementation.
Use EINVAL for out of bounds errno. Return a more
accurate error string with EINVAL.
* spec/posix_spec.yaml (write): Adjust accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

socket.c: fix getsockname() and getpeername()

Both take addrlen as input parameter, which is now properly initialized
to the size of the sockaddr_storage and not some
random value from the stack.

The returned path in sockaddr_un is \0 terminated. Use memchr(sun_path)
to calculate the real sun_path length instead of 108 (sizeof sun_path).
Otherwise we get a lua string with embedded zeros and other garbage.

Signed-off-by: Christian Hohnstaedt <christian@hohnstaedt.de>

unistd: make readlink work reliably in /proc.

Fixes #328
* ext/posix/unistd.c (Preadlink): Simplify with a static
PATH_MAX sized buffer, and factor away bounds checks.
* spec/posix_unistd_spec.yaml (readlink): New examples,
including /proc filesystem symlink read when present.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

poll: fix documentation of return values.

Fixes #346
* ext/posix/poll.c (poll, rpoll): Correctly describe the
returned integer as `0` for timeout or the number of
ready file descriptors.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

doc: fix bad link in rpoll.

Fixes #316
* ext/posix/poll.c (rpoll): Use valid markdown links from LDocs.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

posix: simplify spawn return values, and document changes.

Fixes #335
* lib/posix/init.lua (spawn): simplify combinations of possible
return values, and update Luadocs to reflect that accurately.
* NEWS.md (Incompatible Changes): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

posix.time: set constants strictly by host definition.

Fixes #313
* ext/posix/time.c (CLOCK_MONOTONIC, CLOCK_PROCESS_CPUTIME_ID)
(CLOCK_REALTIME, CLOCK_THREAD_CPUTIME_ID): Guard module constant
definitions individually instead of relying on _POSIX_TIMERS.
* NEWS.md (Bug Fixes): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

unistd.getcwd: Don't leak memory from get_current_dir_name.

Fixes #326
* ext/posix/unistd.c (Pgetcwd): Free the malloced memory returned
by `get_current_dir_name`.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

maint: better flakey example diagnostics.

Fixes #336, Fixes #321
* spec/posix_spec.yaml (fcntl): Show unexpected errno string.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>

posix.time: improve strftime %z and %Z docs and spec examples.

* ext/posix/time.c (strftime): Note typical host %z behaviour in
LDoc comments.
* spec/posix_time_spec.yaml (strftime): Include %Z example.
* spec/posix_deprecated_spec.yaml (strftime): Likewise.
* NEWS.md (Bugs Fixed): Update.

Signed-off-by: Gary V. Vaughan <gary@gnu.org>
Merge branch 'RhodiumToad-time_fixes'

Try and make tests more portable.

POSIX doesn't define the "execute" permissions bits for IPC objects,
and so setting them isn't portable.

POSIX defines the group owner of a new file as being EITHER the egid
of the creating process OR the group of the parent directory (BSD
behavior). The test suite was assuming the former. Avoid the issue by
changing the group of the parent dir to the egid (which should be
allowed even under restricted chown).

Don't assume that IPv6 sockets can send to IPv4 addresses, because
nothing says they should be able to.

Squish whitespace in the default uname string because for some reason
that is failing due to whitespace differences.

This doesn't quite make everything pass under FreeBSD but it gets very
close. Of the remaining errors I get, one is a documented spec
violation (nice() returning 0 rather than the niceness), one is an
unrelated luaposix bug (integer range of rlim_t values), and one is
still unresolved.
